comments:
This problem occurs intermittently.  It could be a timing issue with resource change event handlers invoking while resources are being imported.  The problem could potentially be resolved with the fix for https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=166685 .  Here are the errors found in the log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.common.modulecore 4 4 2007-03-23 08:45:55.315
!MESSAGE Exception while acquiring artifact edit for read.
!STACK 0
java.lang.RuntimeException: This resource has been deleted and can no longer be used.
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.ReferencedXMIResourceImpl.checkDeleted(ReferencedXMIResourceImpl.java:162)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.ReferencedXMIResourceImpl.accessForRead(ReferencedXMIResourceImpl.java:137)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emf.resource.TranslatorResourceImpl.accessForRead(TranslatorResourceImpl.java:350)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emfworkbench.integration.EditModel.access(EditModel.java:954)
    at org.eclipse.jst.common.jdt.internal.integration.JavaArtifactEditModel.processResource(JavaArtifactEditModel.java:150)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.ArtifactEditModel.processResourcesIfInterrested(ArtifactEditModel.java:269)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.ArtifactEditModel.processLoadedResources(ArtifactEditModel.java:233)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.ArtifactEditModel.<init>(ArtifactEditModel.java:154)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.ArtifactEditModel.<init>(ArtifactEditModel.java:102)

    at org.eclipse.jst.common.jdt.internal.integration.JavaArtifactEditModelFactory.createEditModelForRead(JavaArtifactEditModelFactory.java:39)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emfworkbench.edit.EditModelRegistry.createEditModelForRead(EditModelRegistry.java:102)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emfworkbench.EMFWorkbenchContext.createEditModelForRead(EMFWorkbenchContext.java:198)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emfworkbench.EMFWorkbenchContext.getEditModelForRead(EMFWorkbenchContext.java:141)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.internal.emfworkbench.integration.EditModelNature.getEditModelForRead(EditModelNature.java:49)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.ModuleCoreNature.getArtifactEditModelForRead(ModuleCoreNature.java:349)
    at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.ArtifactEdit.<init>(ArtifactEdit.java:344)

    at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.internal.webservice.helper.WebServicesManager$ProcessProjectsWithWSDL.run(WebServicesManager.java:895)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Loading artifact edit for project".

We recently added (in WTP 2.0.1) yet another timing/lock fix that could impact this.  If you can reproduce the bug, please reopen it.
